name: Kepler-337
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-337 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-337 is a star with 2.2699999999999996 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.76 times its radius. It is located 2255.08 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-337 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-337 b

Kepler-337 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 3.29 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-337.

The mass of Kepler-337 b is 2.69 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-337 b is 1.54 that of Earth. At 2.69 Earth masses, Kepler-337 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-337 c

Kepler-337 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 9.69 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-337.

The mass of Kepler-337 c is 5.40 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-337 c is 2.05 that of Earth. At 5.40 Earth masses, Kepler-337 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-337, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
